channel.title: FEAR Radio Chatter - HECU Voice Replacement.
channel.description:
For a while, I've been wondering if I should try my hand at porting over some of the [url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qX73XG9e5BE']enemy chatter from FEAR[/url] to replace the BM grunt voices. It certainly seems to hit all the right notes. Sadly, I have no idea how to go about doing this, as I have no experience doing anything similar...
EDIT: Download latest version [url='https://www.dropbox.com/s/i9j1ka8zxzpm30s/fear%20grunt%20sounds.rar']here[/url]
video 1: [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gO4udqp7xl4&feature=youtu.be[/url]
video 2: [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hev0VDkQINU[/url]

item.title: FEAR Radio Chatter - HECU Voice Replacement.
item.dc:creator: Dragunov2
item.description:
Thanks alot!

Now I have all the files switched

item.dc:creator: brokenfridgehinge
item.description:
Oh great, thought you needed a new url each time. Dropbox rules! I’ll check it out and see if it’s fixed.
Yup, that latest patch seems to have fixed the issue, all the grunts make pain and death sounds now.

Read full topic
item.source: FEAR Radio Chatter - HECU Voice Replacement.

item.title: FEAR Radio Chatter - HECU Voice Replacement.
item.dc:creator: Mr_Someguy
item.description:
Well, the human_sounds_shared.txt should look like that regardless, that’s how it is set up when you download Black Mesa. I just wanted to rule it out as the culprit. The most recent installation is in the dropbox link, as usual (dropbox allows me to update content directly, so the link in the OP doesn’t need replaced, it will always be the latest version). Regardless, I’ll put my file in just incase. Files are updated, just use the dropbox link.

Try reinstalling the whole thing from the latest version, hopefully that fixes it. If not, then I’m completely lost as to what could be wrong :S

Read full topic
item.source: FEAR Radio Chatter - HECU Voice Replacement.

item.title: FEAR Radio Chatter - HECU Voice Replacement.
item.dc:creator: brokenfridgehinge
item.description:
I checked my folders and had all the correct sounds, so I’m not sure why it’s happening.
Make sure you include the scripts folder too, so we don’t have to manually overwrite that ourselves. Have you got a link to your new installation?

Read full topic
item.source: FEAR Radio Chatter - HECU Voice Replacement.

item.title: FEAR Radio Chatter - HECU Voice Replacement.
item.dc:creator: Mr_Someguy
item.description:
dragunov2:

Ok, fixed my folders.

U can double the size, they are not that big

I think I don’t understand it completely sometimes, cause it’s not my native language

Thanks!

Well to be fair, I was always sorta crappy at writing instructions. I think I’ll just set up both folders from the start and do away with the extra confusion.

And it’s done, both folders are set up in the download from the start, installation should be pretty straightforward now.

Read full topic

item.title: FEAR Radio Chatter - HECU Voice Replacement.
item.dc:creator: Mr_Someguy
item.description:
dragunov2:

Well, we had to move the hgrunt_young to a backup folder (followed ur instructions), or do we still need those folder in BMS\sound\vo\npc?

Thanks!

I guess I wasn’t clear with my instructions then, I apologise. My intention was that you copy the hgrunt folder over, then duplicate it and rename the copy hgrunt_young (to keep the download at the smallest possible size).

I might just do that myself, it’d double the size, but nobody would have to deal with my crappy instructions

Read full topic

item.source: FEAR Radio Chatter - HECU Voice Replacement.

item.title: FEAR Radio Chatter - HECU Voice Replacement.
item.dc:creator: Mr_Someguy
item.description:
dragunov2:

Well, if we continue to make replies in this thread, we don’t find u reply with the links in it to the file anymore after a while

That’s true, maybe Fridge can put my link in the OP? Otherwise we could create a separate thread. It’d up to him I think.

Link: https://www.dropbox.com/s/i9j1ka8zxzpm30s/fear%20grunt%20sounds.rar

brokenfridgehinge:

I recorded some footage of the sound pack in action. As you can see, the grunts rarely play their death sounds, I think you need to get that fixed, Someguy.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gO4udqp7xl4&feature=youtu.be

Huh, that’s really strange, I honestly have no idea why that’s happening. Seeing as it happens with nearly every death, I can say it’s almost impossible levels of unlikely that it’s due to the absence of HG_MEDIC02a (that would require the game to attempt playing that sound after every death). I know I packed the files in for deaths, I just checked.

Make sure there are files for HG_MEDIC00 through HG_MEDIC20 are present in BMS\sound\vo\npc\hgrunt_young (this is the folder that death sounds are linked to), and that they work when you attempt to play them. Alternatively go to BMS\scripts\npc_sounds_human_shared.txt and make sure there is a section in there that should look like this:

[code]“NPC_Grunt.Death”
{
“channel” “CHAN_STREAM”
“volume” “0.8”
“pitch” “95, 105”
“soundlevel” “SNDLVL_NORM”

"rndwave"
{
	"wave"	"vo/npc/hgrunt_young/hg_medic01.wav"
	"wave"	"vo/npc/hgrunt_young/hg_medic02.wav"
	"wave"	"vo/npc/hgrunt_young/hg_medic02a.wav"
	"wave"	"vo/npc/hgrunt_young/hg_medic03.wav"
	"wave"	"vo/npc/hgrunt_young/hg_medic04.wav"
	"wave"	"vo/npc/hgrunt_young/hg_medic05.wav"
	"wave"	"vo/npc/hgrunt_young/hg_medic06.wav"
	"wave"	"vo/npc/hgrunt_young/hg_medic07.wav"
	"wave"	"vo/npc/hgrunt_young/hg_medic08.wav"
}

}[/code]

Very nice video otherwise, much better than my crappy short

EDIT:

brokenfridgehinge:

I’ve updated the original post with the latest version, and will continue to do so.

Oh, already taken care of then, thank you! :3

Read full topic

item.title: FEAR Radio Chatter - HECU Voice Replacement.
item.dc:creator: Mr_Someguy
item.description:
amazingcomedy:

Frap’s videos are always insanely huge, much bigger than they should be. I know that from experience.

Yeah, I used Fraps to make it. I don’t know of any other recording services as I don’t make videos.

dragunov2:

Replaced the files aswell!

Maybe make an own thread, cause it’s gonna get lost in the replies

I’m not sure what you meant by this.

brokenfridgehinge:

Use Bandicam and use the 720p preset, you get much smaller videos with decent quality.

I might look into it later if I ever make any videos of anything.

Read full topic

item.title: FEAR Radio Chatter - HECU Voice Replacement.
item.dc:creator: Mr_Someguy
item.description:
brokenfridgehinge:

I’ve noticed the grunts sometimes don’t play any death sound when killed, they just stay silent.

I thought that was normal? I can look into it though, it might be a result of there being no HG_MEDIC02a, which if it is I can just fix it by adding one.

Edit:

Uploading a short video, but it won’t be done by the time I head to bed.

Also, I think I’m going to replace the “Hell Yeah!” line, while I think it fits them, it doesn’t fit the situations it’s used in. I might also see what I can do about scripted scenes later, I should have more time once the weekend ends.

Video is up, it’s only 29 seconds long but it took 14 hours to upload. Also, I don’t know why it’s so dark :retard:

Read full topic

item.title: FEAR Radio Chatter - HECU Voice Replacement.
item.dc:creator: Dadster
item.description:
Concerning lowering the pitch sound of the voices to make them sound deeper, try taking a look at this software, Audio Pitch & Shift.
I haven’t used it and it says it’s mainly for musicians, but I’m sure it’s capable of changing the pitch of any common sound file.

https://i.imgur.com/xXznXxo.png

https://i.imgur.com/dKThV3T.jpg

Read full topic
